KccAns: Orchardist are advised spray any of the following horticulture mineral oils HMOs should besprayed  2 2 litper 100 litof water at delayed dormancy stage when the average day andnight temperatures remain above 4 Degree celat least for two consecutive days

QueryText: How to control hairy root and crown gall of apple
KccAns: IT IS ADVISED ORCHARDIST APPLY UREA  15Kg DAP  750g AND POTASHMOP  25Kg PER TREE HAVING AGE 15 YEARS AND ABOVE WHOLE DAP WITH13RD OF UREA AND HALF DOSE OF POTASH SHOULD BE APPLIED TWO TO THREEWEEKS BEFORE THE TREES COMES OUT OF DORMANCY AND 23RD UREA SHOULDBE APPLIED AFTER FRUIT SET AND REMAINING UREA AND POTASH SHOULD BEAPPLIED IN JUNE BECAUSE IT IMPROVES FRUIT QUALITY AND COLOURDEVELOPMENT AND IN JUNE NEW BUDS START TO GROW SO THE FERTILIZERAPPLICATION IS MOST IMPORTANT AT THIS STAGE

QueryText: Information regarding crown gall disease of apple
Information regarding crown gall disease in apple
KccAns: crown gall disease :-  Symptoms include roundish rough-surfaced galls woody tumourlike growths several centimetres or more in diameter usually at or near the soil line on a graft site or bud union or on roots and lower stems The galls are at first cream-coloured or greenish and later turn brown or black
